definition: good-looking/charming/(of goods) in great demand/(coll.) to season (food)
dialect/language/spoken words/speech/talk/words/conversation/what sb said/CL:種|种[zhong3],席[xi2],句[ju4],口[kou3],番[fan1]

sentences.english: I don't think Linda appreciated my wisecracks .
sentences.chinese: 我看琳達好像不怎麼喜歡我的俏皮話。

sentences.english: At the moment another witty word swam into his mind.
sentences.chinese: 馬上又一句俏皮話出現在他的腦子裏。

sentences.english: Don't worry, he's still full of one-liners and quips.
sentences.chinese: 別擔心，他仍然滿嘴俏皮話一針見血。

sentences.english: Wit has truth in it ; wisecracking is simply calisthenics with words.
sentences.chinese: 智慧中有真理，說俏皮話僅僅是一種文字健身運動。

sentences.english: She continued her story undisturbed by the merry sallies of her hearers.
sentences.chinese: 她繼續她的故事而不受她的聽衆的歡樂俏皮話所打擾。

sentences.english: And some were just waiting to make their share of animal puns.
sentences.chinese: 還有一些人專門等着抖出和動物有關的俏皮話呢。

sentences.english: He kept making wisecracks about people's looks.
sentences.chinese: 他一直拿俏皮話取笑人家的長相。

sentences.english: I'm wisecracking, but I'm telling the truth.
sentences.chinese: 我雖然在講俏皮話，但我說的是實情。

sentences.english: I'm generally shelved among Snoopy calendars and collections of wisecracks .
sentences.chinese: 我的書通常被放在史努比和俏皮話集子中間。

sentences.english: He made a wisecrack about my ability.
sentences.chinese: 他說俏皮話貶低我的能力。

definition: hard to distinguish real from imitation
to stir up public sentiment by false statements (idiom)/to resort to demagogy
variant of 獨角戲|独角戏[du2 jiao3 xi4]
new word (in textbook)/word that is unfamiliar or not yet studied/CL:組|组[zu3],個|个[ge4]
man can conquer nature (idiom); human wisdom can prevail over nature
to force someone to do something
lit. to return the jade annulus to Zhao (idiom); fig. to return something intact to its rightful owner
